EVCC Integration
info:
To activate this flow, edit the environment variables.
- double click on the flow name on the top left
- click on the "list" icon below "done" and next to the settings icon

name: Transform power from db
Read total_pv from db
query:
from(bucket: "evcc")
  |> range(start: -10m, stop: 0m)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "pvPower")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "value")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["id"] == "1" or r["id"] == "2")
  |> last()  // Selects the last value directly
  |> group()
  |> aggregateWindow(every: 1h, fn: sum, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

name: Read soc (home) from db
query:
from(bucket: "evcc")
  |> range(start: -10m, stop: 0m)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "batterySoc")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "value")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["id"] == "1")
  |> last()  // Selects the last value directly
  |> yield(name: "mean")

name: read power from db
query:
from(bucket: "evcc")
  |> range(start: -58h, stop: 0m)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "homePower")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "value")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: 1h, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "mean")

name: Read soc (car) from db
query:
import "math"
from(bucket: "evcc")
  |> range(start: -150h, stop: 0h)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "vehicleSoc")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_value"] != 0)  // Filter out values where _value is 0
  |> aggregateWindow(every: 30m, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> last()  // Selects the last value directly
  |> map(fn: (r) => ({ r with _value: math.round(x: r._value) }))  // Round down the _value
  |> yield(name: "last")

name: Read EOS result from InfluxDB
query:
import "math"

from(bucket: "eos")
  |> range(start: -1h, stop: 0h)
  |> aggregateWindow(every: 1h, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")


from(bucket: "evcc")
  |> range(start: -150h, stop: 0h)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "vehicleSoc")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_value"] != 0)  // Filter out values where _value is 0
  |> aggregateWindow(every: 30m, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> last()  // Selects the last value directly
  |> map(fn: (r) => ({ r with _value: math.round(x: r._value) }))  // Round down the _value
  |> yield(name: "car_soc")

from(bucket: "evcc")
  |> range(start: -10m, stop: 0m)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "batterySoc")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "value")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["id"] == "1")
  |> last()  // Selects the last value directly
  |> yield(name: "home_soc")

name: Readme
info:
# How to use this flow

## Install dependencies
 1. Click on the top right burger bar icon
 2. Click on manage palette
 3. Search for node-red-contrib-influxdb
 4. Install

## Configure InfluxDB settings
 1. Double click on one influx db node
 2. Adjust the InfluxDB settings


## This Flow is using environment variables.
- double click on the flow name on the top left
- click on the "list" icon below "done" and next to the settings icon
- change IP and port

## Write to InfluxDB
This flow writes data to influx db and expects a eos bucket

## PV-Forecast

But waiting for https://github.com/Akkudoktor-EOS/EOS/issues/432


## Add error handling
Errors could be handled much better

## InfluxDB config
- Use variables in read influx DB nodes (bucket_names)
- Use variables in write influx DB nodes

## EOS Power Prediction
Currently we use load_mean because of https://github.com/Akkudoktor-EOS/EOS/issues/428


# DONE
logging of request and respone messages can be activated

name: verify power
verify power
Create start & end datetime
price adjusted from eos
Prepare Payload for PV
func:
msg.query = `
from(bucket: "pvforecast")
  |> range(start: ${msg.utcdate_start}, stop: ${msg.utcdate_end})
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "solcast-HuetteOst" or r["_measurement"] == "solcast-SüdWest")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "pv_estimate")
  |> group(columns: ["_time", "pv_estimate"])
  |> sum()
  |> group(columns: ["pv_estimate"])
  |> sort(columns: ["_time"])
  |> aggregateWindow(every: 1h, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "mean")
`;

return msg;
